answer: Don't get me wrong. I have no problem with your lifestyle. What grown men do in the privacy of their homes is none of my concern.

question: Talon, I'm not...
answer: Hey, I'm in the Navy. I don't ask and I don't expect you to tell. Now, I don't know what Molly's told you about me, but anything bad - I deserve. I hurt that girl. I hurt one of God's own angels and I've regretted it every minute since.

question: No. She speaks very highly...
answer: God as my witness, I WILL make it right. I WILL get her back. Can I count on you to put in the good word for me, Poncho?

question: Um... Sure.
answer: You're the man. Come here. There you go. Feel the tolerance. Roger!

question: What did he do?
answer: Listen, Molly would kill me if she knew I was telling you this but I'm trying to do you a favor.

question: Okay.
answer: Molly has this physical...um issue. You know, kind of like a birth defect?

question: Oh, my God.
answer: It's not a big deal but she's really self-conscious about it. Talon and some other guys she's dated have been weirded out and made her feel like a freak.

question: What is it?
answer: It's better if she tells you but if you can't deal with it, just get lost now and don't put her through that heartbreak again.

question: No, no. I wouldn't do that.
answer: Good. 'Cause if you do, it'll be your last conscious act... Cake?

question: It sent Talon packing.
answer: Well, what's wrong with her?

question: I don't know yet. Patty just said she had a physical issue.
answer: Well that could be anything. Did she say it was a birth defect?

question: Kirk, I'm so sorry about the piano thing. It was stupid of me.
answer: No. I know what you were trying to do. It's okay. I wish I could have played for her but...

question: Well, anyway, thanks for all your help with Katie's party. I know it meant a lot to her. Tonight?
answer: Tonight.

question: Kirk, before we do this, there's something I'm really insecure about and you're going to see it sooner or later so...
answer: Hey, take a look at me. What?

question: Don't rush me... Okay, look.
answer: That's it? That's it? That's the best you can do? This is your big flaw?

question: If you can't handle it...
answer: Jesus Christ! I can't! I thought you were going to show me some kind of hairy growth or a third nipple or something I could work with!

question: What the hell is wrong with you!?
answer: You know what's wrong with me!? I'll tell you! I'm fat! I'm bald! I'm ugly! I'm hairy! I'm uncoordinated! I'm uncreative! I'm not a college graduate! I've never been to Europe! I have a shitty job! I drive a shitty car! You want me to go on!? Because I can!

question: No.
answer: So, here I think that the perfect Molly McCall is finally going to show me a good reason why she's messing around with the likes of me! And this is all you got!? You can't wear friggin' flip-flops!?

question: Kirk, I've given you plenty of good reasons.
answer: Oh, yeah! I'm nice! I'm funny! I ask cute, stupid questions! Right! That doesn't get a three hooked up with a ten! Not in this world!

question: A three what? What are you talking about!?
answer: Look! What the hell is going on here!? What are you up to!?

question: What am I up to!? Good God!
answer: Please, tell me you're a terrorist! Tell me you're on a scavenger hunt! Just tell me something that makes sense because all you're doing is driving me nuts!

question: The only thing I'm going to tell you is that I'd like you to leave.
answer: Fine! I'm going! Webbed feet!? Are you fucking kidding me!?

question: Kirky! Hold up, man! What are you doing!? You can't let her screw up your life!
answer: Get away from me Stainer!

question: Whoa! Don't take it out on me! We both knew this Molly thing wasn't going to work out! It ain't my fault!
answer: You're right. It's not your fault. It's my fault for listening to all your... pernicious advice.

question: What the fuck you talkin' about?
answer: All you did was fill my head with all this crap about threes and tens and how I'm not worthy.

question: Are you worthy of a chick like that?
answer: Maybe! I don't know. But that's not the point! You're supposed to be my God damned best friend. You know what!? I think you were jealous and you set out to sabotage us from the start!

question: That is total bullshit!
answer: Then why weren't you there for me? What if she actually liked me!? Maybe with a little help, I could have pulled it off!

question: No. Get lost. Oh, for Christ sake! This one too!? I'm warning you both - Molly has been through enough. You go near her and I will fuck you all the way up! Understand!?
answer: Listen, bitch... Ahhh!! Jesus Christ!!! Kirk!!

question: Who's your Mommy!? Come on! Who's your Mommy!?
answer: You are!

question: I thought she was a blackjack dealer.
answer: It turns out she bought stock in Caesars Palace back in the sixties. Nobody knew she still had it. I don't think she even knew.

question: Wow. So, what does this have to do with Molly?
answer: See? Now it makes sense - me with her. I'm a millionaire now.

question: How come I'm not a pirate!? Dude, do not tell me that he's going with you guys.
answer: He already bought his ticket and my dad likes him. It's no big deal.

question: Look at me Big Slick.
answer: What?

question: Look at me. Tell me things are good.
answer: Don't be such a drama queen. Things are fine. I gotta go.

question: Alright, man. It was good to see you, Kirk.
answer: Elmer, I've got customers here.

question: Tina, I need to know right now why it didn't work out with us.
answer: That's a large Julius. Twelve fifty.

question: This is important. I was good to you. I was sensitive, right? The fuck you just call me!?
answer: Oh, for Christ's! Tammy! Can you cover me!?

question: Okay folks, we're going to start by boarding the A group. All A's are now welcome to board. Are you folks in the A group?
answer: What difference does that make!?

question: Well, because you seem like a little bit of a B. May I see your boarding pass?
answer: Fine. We're not in the A group but we're still getting on next.

question: I really liked you Elmer, but all that stuff about me being a ten and how lucky you were and always checking up to see if I was going to dump you...
answer: Well, you did dump me, so...

question: What could I do? You were all up in my business all the time. I couldn't breathe.
answer: It was my stupid job, wasn't it? You were embarrassed.

question: I work at Orange Julius, Elmer! If you would have just chilled out and been yourself...
answer: Okay, I can do that.

question: It's okay folks! TSA! This guy's drunk as fuck and he shit himself. We gotta get him off the plane.
answer: Stainer! What are you nuts!?

question: You were right! I messed you up. We gotta fix this thing! Let's go.
answer: Stainer! No! Believe it or not, this isn't about you! In fact it's none of your business!

question: Kirky! In junior high I peed my pants in class and Eric started calling me Stainer, remember?
answer: Okay, yeah?

question: Pretty soon everyone else started calling me Stainer because they knew it would make me cry. Then you told me to own that name, to call myself Stainer so nobody could hurt me with it anymore.
answer: What's your point?

question: My point is... um... Oh, shit. I was just in the crapper and I had this thing all worked out. Damn it. I'm going to have to ask you to fuck off immediately before I feed you your own fuckin' teeth!
answer: Jesus Stains! You're going to get arrested! And I won't be here to bail you out this time.

question: Ooohh! That was my point! You saved me! That time and a bunch of other times too. You gotta let me save you this time. It's my turn! Your grandma didn't leave you three million bucks so you could take these a- holes to Branson. These people hardly know you.
answer: Stainer, I appreciate that you think you're helping me but I'm with Marnie now.

question: You want to see what I think of security!?
answer: Oh, Stainer, what did you do?

question: Kirk! When I added all this up for you I made one big mistake. You are a ten. YOU'RE A TEN, MAN! You're not buying any of this bullshit are you?
answer: No. Randy! Where's Stainer!? Stainer! I don't have a car here! I need your van!

question: Right on! The keys are in my jacket! Kirky wait! Listen, Kirk. It's three on the tree and the clutch sticks.
answer: Thanks buddy!

question: What is it? Okay. Well, what do you want from me? Kids make ashtrays. They're not bidding on the artwork; they're bidding on the kids. It's fine. What are you doing here!?
answer: I came to say I'm sorry and to put in a request for a second chance.

question: I'm sorry. I have to get in there. Can we talk about this afterwards?
answer: I'm looking forward to it.

question: Yeah, I saw that. Tough break in there, my friend. Still, that was a hell of a good thing you did for those kids.
answer: Thanks.

question: Beautiful women huh? What are you gonna do?
answer: I guess I'm going to go home.

question: It's none of my business but I do know a thing or two about hooking up with women who are out of your league. Can I tell you a little secret?
answer: Sure.

question: You realize that there's a good chance this won't work out. And you could get hurt.
answer: I know.

question: And you're going to have to be naked in front of me at some point.
answer: I can work up to that. So, you and me are...

question: Three million dollars for kids with cancer and you sing to me? I'm not made of wood you know. But one condition.
answer: Anything.
